summary: This document is a chain of emails from February 2020 among staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing travel arrangements and approvals for trips related to the ongoing Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail requests for travel to interview witnesses in locations including Pensacola, Florida; Los Angeles, California; West Palm Beach, Florida; and Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY)
persons.context: Coordinates travel bookings and logistics for prosecutors, ensuring flights are refundable and handling reservations for flights and hotels.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Participates in email chain about travel policies and approvals, forwarding requests and providing guidance on booking procedures.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on travel approval and logistics emails, part of the administrative support team.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary requester of travel for the Epstein investigation, details trips for witness interviews in various locations, often traveling with colleagues Alison and/or Maurene.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Frequently travels with Alex and Maurene as part of the Epstein investigation team to conduct victim and witness interviews.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Member of the Epstein investigation team, travels with Alex and/or Alison for interviews in Florida and Los Angeles.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approves travel authorization requests for the Epstein investigation team, final sign-off on trips.

persons.name: Nick Siu
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient for conference room payment requests related to travel.

connections.description: Frequent travel companions for witness interviews as part of the Epstein investigation team.
Travel together for interviews in West Palm Beach and other locations as part of the investigation team.
Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who grants authorization for the trips.
Darlene handles flight and hotel bookings based on travel requests submitted by Alex.
Communicate about travel booking policies and procedures within the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Planned interview of a witness in Pensacola, Florida, conducted by Alex and Alison from the SDNY Epstein investigation team.

events.title: Witness Interview near Stockholm
events.description: Planned international interview near Stockholm, Sweden, for the Epstein investigation, involving the SDNY team.

events.title: Interview(s) in Los Angeles
events.description: Planned interview or interviews in Los Angeles, California, as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Planned interview in Los Angeles, California, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Planned interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, conducted by Alex and Maurene for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
SDNY prosecutors and investigators conducted multiple domestic and international trips in 2019-2020 to interview witnesses and victims in connection with the Epstein case.
Travel logistics show careful adherence to government travel policies, including preferences for refundable flights and use of conference rooms for interviews.
The investigation team, including Alex, Alison, and Maurene, operated under the supervision of Edward Tyrrell, with administrative support from Darlene Alleyne, Michele Duncan, and Cynthia Perez.
